article.headline: Temple 57, Drexel 48
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- David Hawkins scored 26 points and hit the go-ahead 3-pointer with 2:10 left, leading Temple to a 57-48 win over Drexel on Saturday. Temple (1-3) has not lost to Drexel (1-3) since the 1981-82 season, winning eight straight times. Temple leads the series 27-8 and coach John Chaney won his 694th career game. Hawkins scored 15 points in the second half and helped the Owls (1-3) pull away in the closing minutes. Mardy Collins followed Hawkins' 3 with a layup, then Hawkins had a steal in the backcourt, converted the layup and was fouled. He sank the free throw for a 51-43 lead. Drexel's Phil Goss hit a 3-pointer with 50.8 seconds left, but Temple sealed the win from the free-throw line. Collins had 13 points and Keith Butler grabbed 10 rebounds for the Owls. Tim Whitworth had 11 points and 10 rebounds for Drexel and Kennell Sanchez added 11 points. Both teams shot under 40 percent in a sloppy effort. There were 33 turnovers and the Dragons went 9 minutes without a point over the first and second half. Temple, however, wasn't much better and could never pull away early in the second half. Drexel got consecutive 3-pointers from Bashir Mason and Whitworth for a 38-37 lead with 9:34 left in the game. Hawkins went 5-for-6 from the line over the next 3 minutes, giving Temple a 42-38 lead. Drexel would tie it again at 43, but Hawkins hit his 3 and the Owls never trailed again. Hawkins made 14 of 15 free throws and the Owls went 21-for-29 from the line. Drexel was only 5-for-10 from the line. The game was the first in a tripleheader, the Big Five Classic, held at the Palestra. All Division I schools in the Philadelphia area played, with No. 12 Saint Joseph's playing Pennsylvania and Villanova plays La Salle in the nightcap.
